pros: Great benefits Incentive bonuses offered for picking up an extra shift

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Clearwater, FL
pros: 3 day work schedule is nice
cons: You never get the days you want to work and the ortho floor is bad. No enough staff and unrealistic expectations. The CNA’s/PCT’s get the same amount of patients as a nursing home but they are all total care’s.

pros: Amazing OR's! Huge! All new and have everything you can imagine.
cons: The politics and the management were terrible to deal with. Manager has favorites that benefit more than the rest of the team,

pros:

More likely to groom young staff for supervisory positions than promote anyone with seniority.

job_title: Senior Billing Specialist/Oncology in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: To help the patients receive the fair pricing of medical heath and assistance to cover certain treatments.  Interaction with the patient in assisting them to understand the insurance responsibility and the portion that is their responsibility.  Assisting them to sign up for alternate financial programs to help with the portion of their bills that insurance doesn't cover.
cons: Poor team work and willingness to upgrade systems and approaches to billing structures.  Communication of updates, new working avenues to short cut the researching of audits for past due billing failures.  Not completing the research on accounts.  Dropping the account until it's unrecoveralbe from either the insurance company or the patient.

review_title: The work was very challenging, but the hospital was very supportive.
pros: The company communicates very well. I enjoyed the "360 reviews" with my Supervisor and mentor. I always felt supported by every level of management.
cons: The pay was not very good. It was a residency, but the lack of pay made life difficult.

job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Clearwater, FL
pros: good orientation, welcoming, professional staff, provided continuing education for RNs, scrubs were provided by the hospital for all RNs working in the ICUs and were laundered by the hospital
cons: patient census fluctuated in my unit (cardiac surgery) which required floating to other units if our surgeon was out of town;

pros: Annual Pay for Skills as well as Merit Raises.  Management supports clinical staff joining a professional organization.
cons: Senior Management CN IV have the CNIII do the majority of their busy bee work.  Be careful If you clarify anything or don't click with your preceptor especially if they are Filipino, they will get you and Im saying, come together and create a huge no fact lie about someone, and usually will get them fired.

job_title: Lab Medical Assistant II in Clearwater, FL
pros: Flexable shifts with days off during the week allowing time to do errends that cannot be done on the weekends.Future advancement is possible and the pay is good. They have good benifits for fulltime employees.
cons: Working 12 hour shifts can be stressful when the ER gets full early. Breaks may not be used when ER is busy.Trainning is mandatory once a year and can be time consuming.

job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Clearwater, FL
pros: I really can't think of any pros from my experience there from 2008 to 20014.
cons: Before Morton Plant became a part of Baycare they were a wonderful hospital that cared about their employees as much as their patients. I worked for them for from 1996-2002 and their benefits were good and there was a feeling of family among the employees and management.  I worked for them from 2008-2014 and the horror stories I heard and experienced were unbelievable. The fact that they let their Cardiology department wind them up in a Corporate Compliance Agreement with the government is a testament to their worth.

review_title: Not in the best interest of the employees
pros: Annual pay for skills check, PTO, helping patients
cons: Very toxic environment, cliquey management. There is no room for advancement. I have been with this hospital for over 5 years, almost have a Masters degree in nursing and yet, I am still a staff nurse on one of the crappiest units. I have applied and interviewed for higher positions but if you are not part of their clique, good luck. All the employees are negative and disrespectful. Very bad work environment!

pros: They care about their patients. Their goal is clinical excellence. They care about their team members. They are willing to listen to concerns. Offer positive incentives for team members. I love working for BayCare. Their company values match my personal values.
cons: No job is perfect but I cannot think of any cons to list.

pros: Many of the team members have been here 20 years or more. Annual financial bonus if goals are met.
cons: Management and Administration has gotten top-heavy. New managers don't have appropriate experience nor are adequately trained to supervise professional staff.

job_title: Emergency Room RN in Clearwater, FL
pros: Great team work. Love my staff. We have lab, phlebotomy, radiology and transport just for the ed
cons: Too much micro managing. Patient load can be extreme in the snow bird season oct thru may
